text: María Elena Lucena Arcuri (25 September 1914 – 7 October 2015) was an Argentine movie actress. She was born in Buenos Aires. She was known for her roles in Ven, mi corazón te llama (1942); Elvira Fernández, vendedora de tiendas (1942) directed by Manuel Romero with Paulina Singerman; Cinco Besos (1945) in which she worked with Mirtha Legrand; La Rubia Mireya (1948) by Manuel Romero with Mecha Ortiz for which she won Best Comic Actress from the Argentine Film Critics Association; Una noche cualquiera (1951); El calavera (1954) by Carlos Borcosque; and La murga (1963) by René Mugica. Lucena died on October 7, 2015 in Buenos Aires at the age of 101. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1914 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Argentine movie actors Category:Argentine centenarians Category:Actors from Buenos Aires
title: Elena Lucena
